content: tighten the circle a bit more and tidy it up position the nose in the middle of the gnome s front so that about a third of it is above the top of the beard and two thirds below sew the nose firmly down working round it several times the hat brim funnily enough this is what really turns him into a gnome using the lighter shade of yarn and the long tail method cast on 30 stitches work three row in stocking stitch starting with a purl row and cast off knitwise leaving a long tail use the cast on tail to join the short edges working in mattress stitch the purl side is the right side now put the brim on the gnome with the short seam in the middle of the back and pin it in place at the two sides position it centrally over the line between the body and the hat you will have to uncurl it a bit to persuade it to lie flat or nearly flat anyway 8 start by sewing down the top edge of the brim and then go round again pulling the bottom edge down a bit and sewing that down too the rolled brim of the hat should sit nicely above his nose last of all sew a 12 mm / ¾ jingle bell to the top of the gnome s hat don t pull the yarn too tightly you want the bell to hang down towards the front of the hat if he won t stand up straight give him a squidge to settle the plastic pellets and that ll sort him out now you can make some more to keep him company - anyone for a game of gnome bowls abbreviations st / sts stitch / stitches k knit p purl kf&b knit into the front and back of the stitch ssk slip slip knit slip two stitches knitwise or knitwise followed by purlwise one at a time insert tip of left needle into stitches from above put yarn round right needle and knit both stitches together k2tog knit two stitches together pso pass stitch over m1 make 1 by lifting the thread before the next stitch and knitting into the back of it © frankie brown 2022 mypatterns areforpersonaluseonlyandshouldnotbeusedtoknititems forsale pleasedonotusethemforteachingpurposes withoutmypermission 9
